fields.title: Process planning (SDLC)
fields.hint: Understanding of common software development life cycle models (Waterfall, Agile), Scrum concepts and process, pros and cons of tools, technics and approaches used in a development process.

fields.title: Estimation
fields.hint: Terminology understanding, using simple and advanced estimations techniques: Scope, Estimates/Targets/Commitments, Overestimate vs Underestimate, Analogy and Story based estimates, methods: Delphi, PERT, COCOMO II etc.

fields.title: Software requirements engineering
fields.hint: Sources of Requirements, Software Requirements Specifications, Requirements Elicitation Techniques (Brainstorming, Interviews, Survey/Questionnaire, Document Analysis), Functional vs Non-Functional requirements.

fields.title: OOD
fields.hint: An ability to use effectively fundamental OOP knowledge, microarchitectural design patterns (as 3 major groups of GoF design patterns like creational, structural and behavioral) and major macroachitectural patterns (MVC, Layered Architecture, IoC, etc), SOLID principles.

fields.title: DB design
fields.hint: Relational data concepts understanding (Entity-Relationship, normalization, denormalization, transactions). Defining database structure that guarantee data integrity and relations integrity. Define security and structure based optimization. Design complex databases from scratch. Database engines, ACID.
